phy_collision_points.htm+html.head.title: phy_collision_points.htm+html.body.p:87-3
phy_collision_points: This read-only variable returns the number of points of collision detected between the two objects in the collision

phy_collision_points.htm+html.head.title: phy_collision_points.htm+html.body.p:88-3
phy_collision_points: NOTE: This variable is only available in the collision event of a physics enabled instance.

phy_collision_points.htm+html.head.title: phy_collision_points.htm+html.body.p:94-3
phy_collision_points: Real (integer value, or <tt>undefined</tt> if the instance is not physics enabled)

phy_collision_points.htm+html.head.title: phy_collision_points.htm+html.body.p:97-3
phy_collision_points:
{ANY_CODE} for(var i = 0; i < phy_collision_points; i += 1;)
{nbsp_x4}{
{nbsp_x4}part_particles_create(global.Sname, phy_collision_x[i], phy_collision_x[1], global.Spark, 5);
{nbsp_x4}}

phy_collision_points.htm+html.head.title: phy_collision_points.htm+html.body.p:100-3
phy_collision_points: The above code creates particles at all the defined points of a collision between two physics enabled instances.
